DOC.brief_summary: BACKGROUND: The deterioration of musculoskeletal system imposes significant impact on physical activity in older adults. METHODS: This was a randomized, parallel-group, prospective study. All participants received education program including home-based exercise. The IC group consisted of different modalities of exercise while the LEE group performed machine-based exercise. Body composition, muscle strength, and physical performance were measured at their baseline and 3 months follow-up.
DOC.brief_title: Osteoporosis and Fall Prevention High Risk Population Intervention and Follow up in the Metropolitan Area
DOC.criteria: 1. older than 50 years of age 2. high risk as defined from one of the following criteria score>=1 on one minute osteoporosis risk questionnaire 10 year predicted fracture risk >=20% for major osteoporosis fracture or >=3% for hip fracture from FRAX fall>=2 times in pass 1 year 3. having a bone mineral density test within one year period 4. having the capability to understand the study and complete the study interventions 5. willing to participate for the intervention and study follow ups 1. If patients were unable to meet at least the above inclusion criteria.
